Name: Statue of Hathor Nursing Horus
Description: The goddess Hathor appears in the form of a cow surrounded by papyrus reeds. A young prince, representing the god Horus, kneels and suckles from her udder. Hathor hid Horus from his uncle Seth in the papyrus marshes and nursed him. Horus has a plaited lock of hair hanging down on one side of his head. The whole statue is painted white except for the body of the young prince, which is painted dark brown.
